item.description:
Like Duncan Jones’ Moon, Another Earth belongs to a new generation of indie sci-fi that cares less about pricey special effects than about haunting plots about the unknown universe. First time director Mike Cahill’s film begins as a planet seemingly identical to Earth suddenly appears in the sky. Watching it in awe, a high school student bound for MIT (Brit Marling) crashes into a car, killing the wife and son of a celebrated composer (William Mapother). When she is let out of prison, Rhonda looks for atonement by reaching out to the grieving composer, and exploring travel to the parallel earth where an alternate life may be waiting. Winner, 2011 Sundance Film Festival’s Special Jury Prize.

“Like the image of the Earth floating out there, pasted to the heavens, this fine film stays with you, follows you home.” Steven Rea, Philadelphia Inquirer. 92 min

(2011) Directed, photographed and written (with Brit Marling) by Mike Cahill. Cast: William Mapother, Brit Marling, Kumar Pallana and DJ Flava.
